newsitem.title: UK: Shield gains as report sparks bid hopes.
newsitem.headline: Shield gains as report sparks bid hopes.

text.p: Shares in British drug research group Shield Diagnostics Plc rose in pre-market trading on Wednesday as a report in the Times newspaper raised bid hopes around the group, dealers said.
The Times report said there was market speculation of a bid from British Biotechnology Plc at 10.00 stg a share or more, valuing the company at 193 stg.
Shield was up 17-1/2p at 477 by 0718 GMT in volume of 47,400 shares, while British Biotech was unchanged at 257-1/2.

Separately, a report in the Daily Mail noted Tuesday's 30p rise in Shield shares and said there was interest in the stock ahead of a conference in Italy, which will include a paper on Shield's heart disease prediction test.
Shield managing director Gordon Hall said he had no comment on the bid talk, describing it as no more than press speculation.
No-one at British Biotech was immediately available for comment.

Shield shares rose to a record 805p in mid March, more than seven times their level at the end of 1996, but fell sharply after one of the doctors involved in a trial of its products said mishandling of blood samples may have led to misleading conclusions.
However, the company responded by saying it still expected to see the first sales of its heart attack predictor test to go ahead this year.
